text: Pursat is a province in Cambodia. The capital city is also named Pursat. It is between the Tonlé Sap and the Cardamom Mountains. The Pursat River bisects the province. It is one of the nine provinces that are part of the Tonlé Sap Biosphere Reserve.Tonle Sap Biosphere Reserve Environmental Information Database Pursat is home to Wat Bakan, considered to be among the oldest active pagodas in Cambodia.History of Bakan Pagoda, Kambuja Soriya Magazine, Volume 2, 2003, Buddhist Institute, Phnom Penh ==Administrative divisions== The province is divided into 6 districts and 1 municipality: *Bakan *Kandieng *Krakor *Phnum Kravanh *Pursat Municipality *Talou Sen Chey *Veal Veang ==References== Category:Provinces of Cambodia Category:Establishments in Cambodia Category:1907 establishments in Asia
title: Pursat province
